technology.short_description: The smallfolk will obey… if they wish to live.

effects.description: Public order: +2

technology.short_description: "Yarrr, it's a code of conduct - articles, if you will. Think of it as insurance, like."

effects.description: Lord recruitment cost: -75%

technology.short_description: There’s no wriggling out of this one – the harpoon-blade has a barbed edge which tears the flesh of monstrous targets as they struggle to escape.

effects.description: Bonus vs Large: +3 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob (Polearms) and Depth Guard (Polearms) units

technology.short_description: Outstanding veterans, seasoned and with common cause and purpose, are invaluable to the seafaring adventurer.

effects.description: [HIDDEN]Hero recruit rank: +5
Hero recruit rank: +5

technology.short_description: It only takes a bit of light flogging and denial of shore leave for a less-than-stellar reputation to develop.

effects.description: Adds the character Trusty Montford to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: A place for everyone and everyone in their place.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob units

technology.short_description: Pirates have little time for landlubbing matters, so the expertise needed is drafted in from elsewhere.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for infrastructure buildings

technology.short_description: "Just keep them pistols pointed away from your own Vampire Admirals, maties!"

effects.description: Bonus vs Infantry: +3 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units

technology.short_description: If you can keep your head while all around you are literally losing theirs…

effects.description: Upkeep: -15% for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Depth Guard and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.short_description: Those controlled by occult means confound their putrid, decrepit forms.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Depth Guard and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.short_description: A good pirate has the instruments to plot the safest course through the deadliest of seas.

effects.description:
Immune to Storm and Reef attrition
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: "I knew a man who served under 'em once - they takes no prisoners 'n' gives no quarter whatsoever."

effects.description: Adds the character O'Bones Macdonald to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: "You pay us and we keep the darkness at bay… After all, you wouldn't want one of your loved ones to have an... 'accident', would you?"

effects.description: Income from Ports: +10%

technology.short_description: There's no substitute for experience.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Depth Guard and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.short_description: "Our power shall grow greater and greater with every tide…"

effects.description: Growth: +5

technology.short_description: If you're still at sea centuries later and not dead or starving in a gibbet somewhere, chances are you're doing something right.

effects.description: [HIDDEN]Lord recruit rank: +5
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +5

technology.short_description: Notoriety can be acquired for a number of reasons, but mostly for those of the insalubrious kind.

effects.description: Adds the character Burke Black to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: The more brains you have, the more - and better - loot you will bring back to port.

effects.description: Grants the Quartermaster follower to your faction

items.colour_text: A first-class brain on the problem and a firm hand on the tiller.

effects.description:
Income from raiding: +50%
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Keeping the crew on side is important if you wish to remain in charge. A loyal chain of command helps with this.

effects.description: Grants the First Mate follower to your faction

items.colour_text: Every captain needs a reliable functionary at their shoulder to advise and convey orders to the crew.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: It's useful to get an idea of what your destination looks like, as there's barely a moment to think once the cannons start.

effects.description: Grants the Seascape Artist follower to your faction

items.colour_text: It says something about a commander that they feel the need to capture their actions for posterity, don't you think?

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%
Campaign line of sight: +50%

technology.short_description: Obedient and unquestioning, if a little slack-jawed.

effects.description: Construction time: -35% for all buildings

technology.short_description: "Nah - I'll tell yer - you see that banner, you turn the ship around, as they'll be upon yer before you can scream 'Manann, protect us!'"

effects.description: Adds the character Two Toes Adley to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: "That's right, lad, get that sponge right down inside - we want to blow the enemy to kingdom come, not ourselves!"

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Mortar, Carronade, Deck Gunners and Queen Bess units

technology.short_description: …because running out of shot during a violent seaborne action is not an option.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Mortar, Carronade, Deck Gunners and Queen Bess units

technology.short_description: Practice goes a long way towards preparing a crew for the real thing.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Mortar, Carronade, and Deck Gunners units

technology.short_description: "All shall know that we are here as masters to rule!"

effects.description:
Vampiric corruption: +2
	(factionwide)

technology.short_description: "Rise, me hearties, risssssssse!"

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10%

technology.short_description: "Blurgggh! Blurgggh! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaarrggh!!!!"

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15 for Animated Hulks, Mournguls, Rotting Prometheans, and Rotting Leviathan units
Speed: +10% for Animated Hulks, Mournguls, Rotting Prometheans, and Rotting Leviathan units

technology.short_description: Battles at sea are tense, nerve-wracking and bloody. Obey orders - and quickly - if you want to survive.

effects.description: Missile strength: +5% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.short_description: Leaving residue inside a cannon between battles is a sure-fire way of blowing yourselves up! A good maintenance schedule guards against this.

effects.description: Upkeep: -15% for Mortar, Carronade, Deck Gunners and Queen Bess units

technology.short_description: What they don't have really *can* hurt them quite badly, as it turns out!

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +20% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units

technology.short_description: Being technically dead can have its advantages when the fight reaches screaming pitch.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units

technology.short_description: Death is no escape.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.short_description: Knowing the shortcuts, and how best to deploy them, saves time when it really counts.

effects.description: Raise dead cost: -10%

technology.short_description: "No elemental power shall halt them, nor spell nor hex nor charm…"

effects.description: Magic resistance: 20% for Animated Hulks, Bloated Corpse, and Mourngul units

technology.short_description: Magical protection is useful, but cannonballs take the limbs and lives of precious beasts.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 20% for Rotting Prometheans, Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob, Rotting Leviathan and Necrofex Colossus units

technology.short_description: The hotter the explosion, the more easily their rags and dry bones will light up.

effects.description: Missile strength: +5% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob, Deck Droppers and Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob units

technology.short_description: "Flintlocks are a thing of the past; today, we sail into a dark, bloody future."

effects.description: Ammunition: +15% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob, Deck Droppers and Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob units

technology.short_description: Even Dwarfen armour twists and cracks under a barrage of Nuln-forged steel.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10% for Necrofex Colossus units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Necrofex Colossus units

technology.short_description: The best way to fell an empire is to use their own weapons and armour against them.

effects.description: Weapon Strength: +20% for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob and Depth Guard units

technology.short_description: It won't save you from a cannonball in the face, but smaller, indirect shot may be deflected.

effects.description: Missile resistance: +20% for Scurvy Dogs, Fell Bats, Deck Droppers, and Death Shriek Terrorgheist units

technology.short_description: Bound to their captain's will for eternity and beyond.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Animated Hulks, Bloated Corpse, Syreens, Rotting Prometheans, Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob, Mournguls, Rotting Leviathan and Necrofex Colossus units
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Animated Hulks, Syreens, Rotting Prometheans, Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob, Mournguls, Rotting Leviathan and Necrofex Colossus units (minimum 1)

technology.short_description: Not as important when the bomber is already dead, but a full complement of limbs should remain a priority.

effects.description: Grants the Throwing Bombs banner to your faction

items.colour_text: "Now! Throw it now! Don't drop it, you bilge-sucking loon! You'll blow us all to..."

effects.description: Bonus vs Large: +10

Bonus vs Large: +24
	(assigned unit)

technology.short_description: Warships are cramped, hot and dirty, so keeping a small, eager youth around to bring up powder from below makes a lot of sense.

effects.description: Grants the Powder Monkey follower to your faction

items.colour_text: It's an extremely dirty and dangerous job, but someone has to do it. After all, even the highest-rated admiral had to start somewhere.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +15% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units
	(all units in army)

technology.short_description: An expert in his field, able to keep his head under pressure and with a dead-eyed stare.

effects.description: Grants the Master Gunner follower to your faction

items.colour_text: This one can take the head off the enemy captain from fifty yards away.

effects.description:
Range: +15% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units
	(all units in army)

technology.short_description: "Come on, me hearties, let's get at 'em… Yarrrr!!!!!!!"

effects.description: Grants the Skull & Crossbones banner to your faction

items.colour_text: In these days of grand alliances and complex treaties, there is something to be said for making your intentions abundantly clear from the outset.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk
	(assigned unit)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Attribute: Strider
	(assigned unit)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit ignores speed and combat penalties caused by terrain and can move through trees.

technology.short_description: "Power of Undeath, flow through my fingers and align their fallen hearts to my will!"

effects.description: Grants the Spell of the Necromancer's Apprentice banner to your faction

items.colour_text: Practice makes perfect, in Dark Magic as in all things.

effects.description:
Ward save: 20%
	(assigned unit)

technology.short_description: The ship's carpenter repairs battle and storm damage - often whilst they rage and writhe about him!

effects.description: Grants the Ship's Carpenter follower to your faction

items.colour_text: If you're going to take a wooden ship to war, it makes sense to bring someone skilled in its repair too.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -50% for ship buildings
	(Lord's army)
